citeinfo.origin: Western Forest Fire Research Center, Colorado State University
citeinfo.title: 2000 Cerro Grande Wildfire study (Cerro Grande_NM.doc)

citeinfo.origin: Philip N. Omi, Colorado State University
citeinfo.title: Effect of Fuel Treatments on Wildfire Severity -- JFSP 99-1-4-01 {C11B336A-9466-4340-9355-F225B50D07CD}

descript.abstract: The data are from the 2000 Cerro Grande wildfire that burned into an area of the Santa Fe National Forest that had received extensive fuel treatments since 1994 that included mechanical thinning and prescribed burning, both in isolation and in combination. The fire also burned into an area of the Santa Clara Pueblo where several adjacent 1.8 ha plots had been thinned with slash removed by hand in 1991. Ten plot pairs were established that straddled the fuel treatment boundaries. Data collected describe stand conditions and fire severity at each plot.
descript.purpose: The data were collected to assess the effect of the fuel treatments on stand conditions and subsequent wildfire severity.

spdom.descgeog: Northern New Mexico between UTM Eastings 381,200 and 387,924 and between UTM Northings 3,976,945 and 3,982,007 (Zone 13S, NAD27).

idinfo.accconst: Data are owned by Colorado State University and will be used in publications currently in preparation. Data access requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Data access without the express written consent of the Western Forest Fire Research Center is prohibited.
idinfo.useconst: Data are owned by Colorado State University and will be used in publications currently in preparation. Data use requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Data use without the express written consent of the Western Forest Fire Research Center is prohibited.

attracc.attraccr: Error checks have been completed. Crown base heights may be underestimated in high severity plots where lower limbs were consumed. Needle scorch heights are limited by tree height and thus underestimated on completely scorched trees.

dataqual.complete: Plot coordinates are available as points indicating the center of each variable radius plot. The dataset contains no omissions.

enttyp.enttypd: 2000 Cerro Grande wildfire that burned into an area of the Santa Fe National Forest.
